title: How to Make Gingered Pumpkin Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Line a muffin pan with cupcake liners.

steps.headline: Whisk together the canned pumpkin, milk, vanilla extract, brown sugar, and oil in a large bowl.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ground ginger, and salt in another bowl, and mix.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ones a little bit at a time.
steps.description: Combine using a whisk or handheld mixer, stopping to scrape the sides of the bowl a few times, until no lumps remain. Add the diced candied ginger and combine completely.

steps.headline: Fill cupcake liners two-thirds of the way and bake for 22-24 minutes.
Transfer to a cooling rack, and let cool completely before frosting.
Sprinkle additional diced candied ginger on top of the frosted cupcakes (optional).
Cream together the cream cheese and margarine or butter in a bowl completely.
Add the confectioners' sugar slowly in 1/2-cup batches, mixing completely before adding more.
Add the vanilla extract and ground ginger.
steps.description: Beat on high speed until the frosting becomes light and fluffy, about 3-7 minutes.

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (176 degrees Celsius). Line a muffin pan with cupcake liners. Whisk together the canned pumpkin, milk, vanilla extract, brown sugar, and oil in a large bowl.  Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, ground ginger, and salt in another bowl, and mix.  Add the dry ingredients to the wet ones a little bit at a time. Combine using a whisk or handheld mixer, stopping to scrape the sides of the bowl a few times, until no lumps remain. Add the diced candied ginger and combine completely. Fill cupcake liners two-thirds of the way and bake for 22-24 minutes.  Transfer to a cooling rack, and let cool completely before frosting.  Sprinkle additional diced candied ginger on top of the frosted cupcakes (optional).  Making the Frosting Cream together the cream cheese and margarine or butter in a bowl completely.  Add the confectioners' sugar slowly in 1/2-cup batches, mixing completely before adding more.  Add the vanilla extract and ground ginger. Beat on high speed until the frosting becomes light and fluffy, about 3-7 minutes.
